STEP Mathematics papers

STEP Mathematics is an examination paper in the UK. Cambridge University uses it as an admissions test. The best way to prepare for an examination is to practise. When I took the paper in 2007 the past papers were expensive to acquire. Since then, the exam board Cambridge Assessment have published the past papers freely. This is a Good Thing for Access.

It happens that the exam board have published the past papers inside zip archives. This makes them inaccessible to search engines. For posperity, I've republished the papers at document publishing website Scribd: http://www.scribd.com/hmphry/documents where I hope they'll remain accessible for a few years at least. Since the exam board have already published them freely I have no copyright qualms.

Suggestions for anywhere I could reliably publish the documents for 10+ years are welcome.
